jbt.execution.core
Interface IContext

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicContext, HierarchicalContext, SafeContext, SafeOutputContext
public interface IContext

Interface defining the context of a behavior tree task. The context of a task is a set of variables, each one consisting of a name and a value. This interface defines some methods for manipulating such variables.

A context also contains a set of behaviour trees that can be accessed by tasks using the context. Reusability is very important for behaviour trees. In general, a behaviour tree will be made of some tasks of its own as well as references to other behaviour trees. When tasks need to retrieve references to other behaviour trees, it will be the context that will provide with them. Thus, the context defines a method for retrieving behaviour trees by name.

Author:
Ricardo Juan Palma Dur√°n

Method Summary
 void clear()
          Clears the set of all the variables of the context.
 boolean clearVariable(java.lang.String name)
          Clears the value of a variable.
 ModelTask getBT(java.lang.String name)
          Returns the behaviour tree whose name is name, or null in case it does not exist it the context.
 java.lang.Object getVariable(java.lang.String name)
          Returns the value of a variable whose name is name, or null if it is not found.
 boolean setVariable(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object value)
          Sets the value of a variable.
 

Method Detail

getVariable

java.lang.Object getVariable(java.lang.String name)
Returns the value of a variable whose name is name, or null if it is not found.

Parameters:
name - the name of the variable to retrieve.
Returns:
the value of a variable whose name is name, or null if it does not exist.

setVariable

boolean setVariable(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.Object value)
Sets the value of a variable. If the variable already existed, its value is overwritten. value may be null in order to clear the value of the variable.

Parameters:
name - the name of the variable.
value - the value for the variable.
Returns:
true if a variable with the same name already existed, and false otherwise.

clear

void clear()
Clears the set of all the variables of the context.

clearVariable

boolean clearVariable(java.lang.String name)
Clears the value of a variable. This is equivalent to calling setVariable(String, Object) with a value of null for the second argument.

Parameters:
name - the name of a variable.
Returns:
true if the variable existed, and false otherwise.

getBT

ModelTask getBT(java.lang.String name)
Returns the behaviour tree whose name is name, or null in case it does not exist it the context.

Parameters:
name - the name of the tree to retrieve.
Returns:
the root of the behaviour tree whose name is name, or null in case it does not exist in the context.
